Interface CoordinateTransformer

All Known Implementing Classes:
LinearTransform, MercatorTransform, SmithChartTransform
public interface CoordinateTransformer
Non-linear coordinate transform for specialized renderers (e.g. Smith, Geo).

Implementations must be allocation-free and write into the provided arrays.

Since:
1.5.0
Version:
2.0.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final ThreadLocal<double[]>
    SPATIAL_SCRATCH
    Thread-local scratch buffer to avoid per-call allocations in batch helpers.

  • Field Details

    • SPATIAL_SCRATCH

      static final ThreadLocal<double[]> SPATIAL_SCRATCH
      Thread-local scratch buffer to avoid per-call allocations in batch helpers.

  • Method Details

    • mapToPixel

      void mapToPixel(PlotContext context, double x, double y, double[] out)
      Maps model coordinates to pixel coordinates.
      Parameters:
      context - base plot context
      x - model X
      y - model Y
      out - output array (length >= 2) for pixel coordinates

    • mapToData

      void mapToData(PlotContext context, double pixelX, double pixelY, double[] out)
      Maps pixel coordinates to model coordinates.
      Parameters:
      context - base plot context
      pixelX - pixel X
      pixelY - pixel Y
      out - output array (length >= 2) for model coordinates

    • mapToPixelBatch

      default void mapToPixelBatch(PlotContext context, double[] inputCoords, double[] outputCoords, int pointCount)
      Batch maps model coordinates to pixel coordinates.

      Input and output are packed as (x1,y1,x2,y2,...).

      Parameters:
      context - base plot context
      inputCoords - packed model coordinates (x1,y1,x2,y2,...)
      outputCoords - packed pixel coordinates
      pointCount - number of points

    • mapToSpatialBuffer

      default void mapToSpatialBuffer(PlotContext context, double[] inputCoords, SpatialBuffer buffer, int pointCount)
      Batch maps model coordinates into a spatial buffer as (x,y,z) triples.

      By default, the mapped pixels are written as x/y with z=0.

      Parameters:
      context - base plot context
      inputCoords - packed model coordinates (x1,y1,x2,y2,...)
      buffer - spatial buffer to receive xyz triples
      pointCount - number of points
